ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 10 hours/week
3 hours during normal weeks; 5-7 hours during midterm week; about 8 hours for final project
About one or two. I only spent time working on lab assignments if I did not complete them during the lab session. I also studied for the midterm.
2hrs
1 to 2 hours.
2 hours
5 hours/week
2-3hours for lab15-20 hours on the final project
1-2 hours working on labs outside of the lab sessions.12+ hours on the final project.
Approximately 2 hours per week outside the classroom.
7 hours
3-4 hours
3 hours (depends on the length of the lab; the early ones were very short, the later ones very long)
Varies depending on how much work I get done in lab. ~2-4
It varied but approximately 5-6 hours a week especially when labs were time consuming or difficult
Between 5 and 10 depending on the difficulty of the weekly lab assignments.
10, more hours were spent during the project (about 60 hrs in total)
5 hours
2-3 hours, mostly in lab. More for the final project.
About 5 hours per week.
About 1-2 hours per week until after Thanksgiving. During our work on the final project I spent about 15-20 hours a week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: very good
I like this course! Learned a lot.
More practical will be better. Lab part is perfect, but sometimes I feel the lab and lecture are not so connected.
good

the labs were educational, but frustrating, sometimes. The in class part wasn't super helpful, and maybe we could learn more about the math behind the statistical analyses that we do with the software.
The labs were more useful than lecture.

strength: good introduction to the course and the softwareweaknesses: final assignment was not very well thought out, seemed off the cuff and not representative of what was taught throughout the semester-labs seemed rushed-would have been better to have more in-lab time

The labs were useful for learning how to use GIS. The lectures were interesting but did not really help to learn the program. They were very conceptual and I often felt like I didn't understand much of what was described. There was a disconnect between the lecture and the lab.
The lectures and the labs were disjointed and the objectives of the course were not clearly defined.
strengths: great content, good labs, applicable, great skill to learnweakness: time of the class (too early)
Good combination of lecture and lab sessions. Lectures were a lilted bit dreary but provided necessary theory for the lab assignments. Overall, very good class.
I think the course material itself is very interesting, and the labs are very helpful.
It was good.
The lab is a definite necessity because while it is good to hear about the different aspect of the program in class, it is more beneficial to get to practice using them and the GIS program.
I learnt a lot through this class
Lab instruction was helpful in understanding the lecture material. Could provide more instruction or background for labs ahead of time.

The biggest weakness is the time: 8:00AM. It's an interesting class, but anything at 8:00AM is terrible. Everything else is good. The lab sessions are very informative, lectures are straight and to the point, and the assignments are reasonable.

This is an organized and well taught course. Labs can get very long sometimes, but the skills we learned are invaluable. I am more confident in using GIS than ever before.Class is too early and gets long and boring. Most students zoned out half way through class.
The lab is great, but the lecture material is not always super helpful. More emphasis on practical applications and how to interpret maps/outcomes would have been helpful.

Strengths: The weekly labs were well-run and very helpful in learning the basics of using ArcMap.Weaknesses: The lectures were not helpful in teaching applications of GIS in public health. They focused more on the theoretical and mathematical aspects of GIS. Which...was not useful when it came time to actually apply practical skills that we had supposedly learned in lecture to the final project.

This would be much better as a class meeting 2x a week in a computer lab so that students could follow along with the lecture and work through the program. I don't feel like I learned as much as I had hoped to going into this class. A comprehensive understanding of when to choose what sorts of spatial statistics to use, the pros and cons of each, why certain things work and certain things don't was lacking.This class has so much potential but the way in which class time is used and the type of materials covered could be much improved.
The lab component of the course was the most useful. I wish the lectures had been more driven by practical application.

good class, useful information, but the lecture and lab seemed like two totally separate classes. also, this is a weird thing to "complain" about but the midterm exam was really really easy. the final project was also set up in a way that we weren't really able to do too many interesting analyses on the data.
I think the lab component of the class was the most useful part. The lecture was good, but I think I will remember more from the hands on part.
Have labs which help me practice skills learned in class. However, labs were a bit difficult to follow. A lot was covered and it was too fast for me.

This course was an interesting introduction into the GIS software. The lab sections aligned with the material learned in the classroom, and we typically were able to get the majority of lab material completed during section. The weakness of the course seeemed to be the variability in TAs. The TAs who went through the lab step-by-step and explained what was expected for the assignment were most effective.
Lectures were dry and hard to follow, labs introduced analytical techniques but did not encourage exploration of the program or development of proficiency without detailed instruction.

This is definitely useful as an introduction to GIS, and I'm glad I have this skill now. Sometimes the lecture and the lab seemed a bit separate, and I wish we had learned how to do a few more things in ArcGIS.I also think the final project should have been revised a bit. The objectives and expectations were not made clear, and so many groups spent a lot of time simply readying their data (and then having to redo it when they realized it wasn't what was needed) and less on the maps; this was a class on GIS, not data management, so the final project and its data set should have better matched that.
This course is very relevant to any person in public health

-Labs were great-Lecture was less helpful, too much time was spent on GIS theory, the class got much better on the end when we focused on specific statistical methods-Lecture was dry and hard to pay attention to as we had no context for the material until we got our lab assignments. I would suggest holding it in a computer lab (but still have regular lab) and integrate short examples into the lecture-Midterm was very easy, and didn't cover a lot of the material that was presented in the first half

The course provides students with a solid foundation of GIS. While the lectures provided a theoretical understanding of GIS tasks, it would have been more helpful to delve deeper into ArcGIS software functions and processes.
Great class. The material was applicable to a wide range of topics and the labs were very helpful.
I enjoyed learning GIS and have have better knowledge about the program after this course.
The class structure (1 lecture, 1 lab per week) was a strength.I did not find the textbook very helpful.
Good course. Lab heavy. Lecture were too early.

strengths:learned the basics of GIS software and the basics of the types of analyses you can do.weaknesses: not enough hands on work that was independent of labs, lectures went too slow, could have learned more in the first couple of lecturesDo not feel that I am proficient in GIS

The lectures were informative, but sometimes the examples were not updated. The TAs were not equally as competent and often clarified lab assignments in the last day or two before due dates, which required many assignments to be redone if completed on a reasonable schedule. The content and potentially useful nature of it was the greatest strength of the course.
Good. I really learned a lot from the class and I think I will be able to bring this skill with me into the workplace. The class could have started a little later (2 hrs for an 8Am is rough!)
if the data for final can be tested first and clearer instruction can be given at the beginning that will be great.This class is super useful and great for future work in epidemiology.
The final project was a little unclear...could have done with more instructions.

The strengths of the course were teaching basic methods of spatial analysis in GIS, and providing the framework for the theoretical aspects of spatial statistics. I did not particularly like the textbook that we used for the course. I did not feel that it was a good resource to supplement the class material. It was a good book for providing both theoretical aspects and instructions on how to use the GIS software, but it often didn't go enough into depth for my liking.

Strengths: The labs gave us an opportunity to get hands-on GIS experience and see how raw public health data could be displayed to convey information clearly.Weaknesses: While Dr. Holford did a good job explaining the material, the subject matter in the lectures was a little dry. It might have been nice to spend more time looking at and interpreting maps in the lectures.

STRENGTHS: The two hour weekly labwas a great chance to gain hands on experience using GIS for structured projects and to ask questions. The final project was a great chance to apply the skills learned throughout the semester, and the presentation day was a fun chance to display our hard work and to see what other students had worked on for the final project. WEAKNESSES: Some of the material in the lectures was a little advanced, but this did not jeopardize my overall understanding of key concepts. IMPROVEMENTS: none

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Theodore Holford  Very good
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is so nice :)
Instructor: Theodore Holford  He is nice! It is just too early to have a course at 8am.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  nice
Instructor: Theodore Holford  the instructor is fine just the topics were a little slow in the in class portions.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Nice and knowledgeable, but lectures were too abstract.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  He is very well-versed in spatial analysis. I enjoyed listening to him talk but did often feel lost. It may help to spend more time explaining the basic concepts of GIS before delving into the very complex details.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Seems very brilliant, but did not always translate his knowledge well to students. Very fair and kind.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  very sensitive to student needs
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford was very friendly and attentive.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Given this is an introductory course and I do not have any past experience working with the software, I feel the lectures are often really hard to understand (the professor should explain more, and use more lay terms).
Instructor: Theodore Holford  He was good.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  The instructor was great.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Responsive to students' questions
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Good at explaining methods, but sometimes it was hard to follow without a computer directly in front.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  The professor seems very kind and supportive of students. I don't think he has any weaknesses.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is very approachable and a soft spoken professor. He is knowledgeable. His slides are clear and easy to follow. His teaching style is dry, which is understandable because this class focuses on technical skills and computer software programs can get very tricky and hard to explain.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Very knowledgeable.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is clearly very intelligent, but it was sometimes difficult to reach him. The dynamic of the class should change and be more interactive. Students would benefit from working with him in GIS during class time in an interactive fashion.I don't feel like many of us understand the ins and outs/nuance of GIS nor were we exposed to enough materials to demonstrate the kinds of things that GIS can be used for.The idea of doing a final project was great but the way it manifested itself was frustrating. There were lots of directions given last minute and a different set of data or a set to which we could have more readily applied things we had learned in class would have been better. Also, there was very little initial communication about when everything was due.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  The instructor lectures at a good pace and is very organized in his presentation of information. I wish his explanations of more complex concepts were more clear.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford was great. His lectures provided a base of knowledge that we could take into the labs to complete the assignments. I thought lectures were interesting and he was approachable with questions
Instructor: Theodore Holford  He was very sensitive and appropriately addressed issues.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Lecture style was very dry, making it difficult to pay attention. Lectures would be improved with more dynamic instruction, either incorporating greater student participation or with demonstrations of analysis techniques.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Very nice, very knowledgeable. Provided good explanations
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is great, he knows the material and knows how to present it in an interesting and applicable way.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  -PowerPoints were good but the lecture didn't add anything additional
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford was a wonderful instructor.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Did a great job!

Instructor: Theodore Holford  I enjoyed Dr. Holford. He was kind-hearted and responsive when his back wasn't turned to the class. It was sometimes hard for students to get his attention. Other than that I really enjoyed him, the lectures were informative and I believe prepared you as much as they could without being in front of ArcGIS.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford provided me with a good base of knowledge to learn GIS. He was also responsive to any questions that I had which I really appreciate. Thank you.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Professor Holford was incredibly helpful both in and out of class. He responded to e-mails promptly and thoughtfully. I was also very impressed when he posted slides with audio annotation after class was canceled due to the hurricane.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Great instructor. He is organized and caring for his students. I enjoyed the final project, which was low-stress but was able to review and also learn a lot from.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Strengths-pushing about the fundamentals behind maps and the analysisWeakness: at times the lectures could have been combined, especially the first few. I understand the history is also important, but for a class that meets only once a week, this could have been taken out to optimize class lecture time. More hands on time would have been great as well to understand the components of the software. The same could have been said about the labs-the first few were so basic but then it became much more difficult in a short span of time that could have been spaced out much more efficiently.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  The instructor was always prepared and is very knowledgable, but sometimes provided examples that were not updated.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holfod is a great professor. He is very knowledgeable and the midterm was fair.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Clearly explain the concept of the class and provide us further insight into GIS.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Professor Holford created generally very useful powerpoint slides for the course. I felt that at time the lecture was not interactive enough, but this also could have been because the class was a very early morning class. I appreciated that he added audio comments to the lecture that we missed due to Hurricane Sandy.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Strengths: Dr. Holford clearly understood and could well explain the GIS concepts and functions. His lectures flowed well and were easy to follow.Weaknesses: None.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is a very enthusiastic instructor, and he took the time to answer every question thoroughly.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Very good
My TA Owais is awesome. He's very knowledgeable and is very patient on helping us.
I like Owais. Cate is a little less good at explaining clearly.
great
Kate Hacker was a good TA, but I think the labs were kind of confusing and they were hard to prepare for, so sometimes we would all get different answers or the TAs would grade differently on things.
TA: Owais. Very good TA; knowledgeable and friendly.
-did not seem entirely comfortable with leading the lab, did explain why we chose some settings or the rationale behind it-addressed questions as much as possible and was very patient(kate)

Kate Hackard was my TA. She was very helpful for the most part. The labs improved over the span of the course. It was much more useful when there were presentations about what we would be doing before we completed the lab.However, sometimes we were not told what was expected of us to receive all of the points on the lab. For example, having to cite the source of the data within the maps or include very specific statements in the descriptions where not told to some of the lab sections.
Owais was awesome.
VERY sensitive to student needs. Excellent (catherine)
They all were excellent; very attentive and approachable. It was a pleasure to work with them.
My TA is Owais Gilani, and I think he is a great TA for this course. Very helpful, patient and respond to students' emails very fast. I would definitely recommend him for TA awards if there is one.
She was good.

My individual TA did not seem to be prepared for class. She often neglected to share important information regarding the lab to us which resulted in us losing points on the assignment. We once had a substitute TA teach our lab and he was fantastic, we all agreed everything was more clear and we learned a lot that day.

The TAs should check the project datasets before they distribute the project work and datasets. Many students had to switch topic last minute, which significantly limit our ability to do comprehensive analyses of underlying social factors.
Helpful, encouraging, and fast at responding to questions via email.
Owais was very nice and straightforward in lab. He clearly wanted to make sure everyone was able to complete their work.

Katherine is great overall. She knows how to use GIS well. However, she does have trouble explaining some concepts during lab. Also, she does not seem to know what is going on with other TAs and occasionally misinform students about what suppose to be onthe lab write-ups.
Owais GilaniGreat TA! Extremely helpful in the lab
2 / 3 of the TAs were amazingly helpful. I just wish they had held more office hours each week.

The TAs were really difficult to get in touch with. Each TA should offer different office hours throughout the week so that more people can work with them. The TAs also need to work with one another to make sure they discuss with one another what will be graded and how it will be graded. There was inconsistency among what the sections were shown how to do and what sections were told to turn in that resulted in students from certain sections being less prepared for completing the labs or that led to students losing points on labs.Owais substituted and taught our lab once and it was so different. He did an excellent job working through the program and explaining what we were doing and why we were doing it. He did a great job as a TA and was helpful in making sure everyone understood the purpose of the lab.

Catherine Lerro was an excellent lab leader. She was patient, clear, competent and helpful. She was also very responsive if we needed additional help, taking time to answer emails in detail and to meet with us outside of lab if needed.
Owais was a great TA. He was knowledgeable about the software and could find the answer when we had a tricky question. He was clear and helpful.
TAs were helpful

My TA for the course was Owais Gilani. He was an extremely helpful TA throughout the semester. He went through the lab exercises step-by-step, explicitly discussed what to include in our lab assignments, and provided discussions on how the material connected back to lecture. He was always responsive to emails and questions.

Owais Gilani -Excellent TA. He provided, in addition to the necessary components to complete the lab, tips and tricks that made working with GIS easier. Very good at explaining what we were doing at each step.

Kathryn--not the best. She was fine, but often went quickly through sections and when students were having troubles, instead of helping them through, she would ask them to wait, continue with class, and then answer the question at the end of class; students then missed the rest of the lab, not being able to progress beyond the earlier obstacle. I also got the feeling that she felt frustrated and/or resentful of having to answer my questions--really not the attitude a TA should have (or the feeling she should give students).Additionally, her section was all about going through the process of completing the lab. I didn't realize this fully until Owais lead one of our labs and did an excellent job of explaining the significance of what we were doing; after that class, I felt I really understood what was happening in that lab, and benefited the most from it (give that boy a raise!).
My TA was very helpful, she knew how to answer my questions and was always available to help.
My TA was very helpful, she e-mailed me back immediately if I had a question

The TAs were great. However, I did not appreciate receiving emails from the TAs a few days before the labs were due (after I had already submitted my lab) with changes or new expectations. In the future, it would be helpful if all TAs were on the same page and communicated the same expectations so correction emails were not necessary.
Catherine Lerro did a great job! She moved through the labs at a good pace and answered any questions we had.

There was some gross miscommunication between the TAs. I'm not sure what happened but I was highly disappointed that I would receive points off of my labs for things that were not mentioned in our lab section.
Cathy was a really good TA and she was good at answering any of my questions. Thank you.
Owais Gilani - Owais was very helpful and patient during our lab session. He explained each step thoroughly.
TAs were all individually good. However, there needs to be more organization from the TAs collectively.
Cathy Lerro-Cathy was great. She was organized, walked you through the lab and responded to emails in a timely manner.

Kathryn Hacker was always helpful during lab and made every effort to answer questions or to later provide answers through email. Owais covered one lab session and demonstrated a superior understanding of concepts and provided excellent explanations of the rationale behind procedures.

Owais was a fantastic TA. I don't think I would have been able to successfully complete this course without his patience and assistance. He is great at explaining and always willing to slow down to help the class. He also never hesitates to stay after class to help students.
Owais is a great TA. He is knowledgeable and always very patient to help!The lab he teaches is well organized with clear logic.

Owais Gilani was my TA for the lab sessions. He was an exceptional TA and led the labs very well. Owais was great at providing clear instructions for the labs and at making sure everyone was keeping up during the lab session. He answered questions clearly and was always willing to help.

My lab TA was Owais Gilani. He was an excellent TA! He explained the lab assignments clearly, he made sure no one in class fell behind during the lab, and he was able to answer questions. He was always willing to stay behind after the lab was completed to provide help and answer questions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes,it's very useful
Take it. At least you could learn a new skill.
informative
You get comfortable with the software, but don't know too much about analysis
Yes...GIS is a very cool tool and will be useful in the future.

I wouldn't recommend it without reservations. If the student wants to learn GIS for an independent project like a thesis, I would encourage them to take it and go to office hours. However, the course did not provide enough skills to many of us to feel comfortable or competent with the program.

If you have previous work with GIS and are taking this course to sharpen skills, you may find the course helpful. If you're a beginner, you'll likely be lost throughout the course (yet still be able to do well).
Great course to take to learn a new skill

This is a great introduction course to learn about spatial mapping and analyzing spatial relationships. It provides practical software knowledge to use in disease mapping, geographical correlations studies, assessment of risk in relation to a point or line-source or cluster detection.
I would recommend this course for a fellow student, given personally I feel the course material is very useful in the public health field, and it does not hurt to learn a new skill.
The course was good.
I would recommend this course. It is a very practical course and it teaches you to use GIS which can be helpful for thesis and for jobs. GIS is a great skill to have.
Yes. It is very useful
Yes, GIS is a good skill to have especially with the emergence of modeling and a more global focus in public health.
This course is an interesting and not too rigorous class. I would recommend it to another student.
Take it. Knowing how to use GIS is a valuable skill to have for public health. This class prepares you well in applying GIS to various occasions.
I would recommend it to someone interested in spatial analyses.
I would not recommend this class. At the end of the semester, I feel like I learned very little actual GIS skills. I would encourage other students toexplore GIS classes at different schools.
Could be improved--has potential!
It's a great course that will introduce you to GIS. The work load is reasonable, and the material is actually fun.

This is a great introduction to GIS in general and ArcGIS in particular. You learn a lot of the basics on how to use the software. I would recommend this to other students. The lab in particular was really useful.
Yes. I would definitely recommended

The course involves learning introductory material about GIS in the classroom, and subsequently applying it in the computer lab. The TA for your lab section seemed to make a huge difference in your experience with the course. My TA went through the lab exercises incrematally, and discussed expectations which helped immensely. I would recommend this course to another student if they were looking for a basic introduction into GIS, but to also investigate GIS courses in the School of Foresty as I have heard great things about those courses as well.

Although this is a solid introduction to GIS, I did not get as much out of it as I would haveliked. I think my time would have been better spent attending the GIS workshops and playing with the program on my own.

GIS is a useful skill to have, if you want to be able to do spatial analyses. The class could be improved, but it does teach you how to use the program, as well as some of the background theory of what's going on, which you can't get from a mere manual of how to use ArcGIS.
I would recommend it to any student in my department and I really wish that GIS was required for students in EHS.

I feel like this class was effective in teaching the basics of GIS, and I would suggest this to anyone in Epi or Biostats, as GIS is a marketable skill. However, the lectures go into a lot more detail than is needed for the application of the knowledge, and if someone was choosing between a lot of classes I would suggest to skip this class and take the GIS workshops offered by Stacy Maples.
This course will provide you with a solid foundation to ArcGIS.
Very useful class. I would definitely recommend it.
I'd recommend it.
If you want to learn GIS take this Course.
I would definitely recommend this class. I feel very confident using GIS at this point and am excited about applying what I have learned in the class to other projects.

The course will only teach you the basics of GIS and you will feel fairly proficient. However, you will need additional course and/or an independent study to fully utilize the basics of mapping and GIS in a way that could be deemed proficient in the program.
I would recommend this course with reservations. The course content is very interesting, but it was extremely annoying to have to redo assignments nearly every week.
Great introductory course. I learned a lot of skills that I am sure will help me in my PublicHealth profession.
yes , it's a great course to improve your understanding in field epi.
Useful if you want to go into public health jobs, definitely makes you stand out if you having working knowledge of GIS.

This course gives a good overview of the applications of GIS in epidemiology and public health. We learned how to analyze spatial data and draw conclusions about trends at a basic level and how to create meaningful maps using the GIS software. I would recommend this course for someone who might use GIS in their research but is unfamiliar with the program.

I would recommend this course to any student who wants to learn how to use GIS. It is a really useful skill to have, and this course provides the theory (lecture) and practical experience (lab) to feel comfortable using the program. I only wish there were more advanced GIS courses!!
